page.title: 01Yelden, Location
page.content: Yelden is still a relatively unspoilt village in the North of Bedfordshire close to the Northamptonshire border and about 14 miles north of Bedford. There is a stream which runs through the village called the Till. The village comprises of a main street and two lanes, Church and Spring which converge to make a triangle. There is a Church and a Chapel, a Public House, a Village Hall and lately a tea room, but no Post Office, shop or school. A landmark in the village is Castle Field with it's remains of a Norman Mote and Bailey Castle.
